context: we looked at part number one of the church of the Laodiceans. We looked at verses 14 through 17 and while we noted that portion of scripture, we understood that God reminded the church of the Laodiceans of his position and of his power and we were reminded that he introduces as he's writing to them in verse number 14, he's telling John to write this.
the one who is the amen as he said in verse 14, the one who is faithful, who is the faithful and the true witness
Notice as we begin reading in verse 18, the Bible says this, I counsel thee.

I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire that thou mayest be rich and white raiment that thou mayest be clothed and that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear and anoint thine eyes with eyes of that thou mayest see.
As many, verse 19, as I love, I rebuke and chase and be zealous therefore and repent.
Behold, I stand at the door and knock. If any man hear my voice and open the door, I will come into him and will sup with him and he with me.
To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne even as I also overcame and am set down with my father in his throne.
Thou art neither cold nor hot. I would thou work cold or hot in verse 15.
Verse 16, so then because thou art lukewarm and neither cold nor hot, I will spew thee out of thy mouth.
He tells them in verse 17, here's what you say. I am rich, increased with goods, have need of nothing.
He continues with the counsel in verse 18. Notice he says, and white raiment. Notice what he says, that thou mayest be clothed and the shame of thy nakedness do not appear.

He says that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear. We find that he ends here at the end of verse 18 with the council, the third part of the council is to anoint thine eyes with eyesalve that thou mayest see.
And he's given this counsel to the church of the Laodiceans, to the people there, because they need God's counsel and God's statutes are right.
as many as I love, I rebuke and chasten

as many as I love, I rebuke and chasten

I stand at the door and knock. If any man hear my voice and notice this, this is the choice and open the door and open the door.

Jesus, the God of the universe, the one who the preacher preached about this morning that is worthy, the one who created us, the one who has redeemed us, he stands at the door and he knocks and he says, if any man notice, he says, if they hear my voice and open the door, notice the wonderful fellowship. I will come into him and will sup with him and he with me.
the Holy Spirit of God has given us this portion of Scripture and in view is the Lord Jesus Christ who remember in Revelation 5 in verse number 5 is known as the lion of the tribe of Judah.
